intro: Pleomele lanaiensis, commonly known as Lanai bamboo or the Hawaiian bamboo, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Agavaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clustered leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
